column4: i'm having some problems initializing a private key, i keep getting "Could not open a connection to your authentication agent."
problem is, i'm connected to ubuntu linux via putty.
when i type in ssh-agent, it lists all the socket information etc, i made sure the socket is created and it is, but i cannot type xterm since i'm not in a linux enviornment.
You need to add those variables ssh-agent outputs to your environment. You can do this by copy/pasting them, or running it through eval "eval $(ssh-agent)"
i'll show you what it does.
let me paste on pastebin
http://rafb.net/p/tmMxFo43.html
i've read that typing in xterm can resolve the problem, but i'm on windows using putty.
try "eval $(ssh-agent)"
You are expected to run the output from ssh-agent as shell-commands.
that seemed to work
why  did that work ?
just curious, why did that work ?
ssh-add uses the environment variables SSH_AUTH_SOCK and SSH_AGENT_PID to figure out which ssh-agent to use. So those needs to be set.
how can i make sure i don't have to run that all the time ?
do i just add it to my .bashrc file ?
echo "eval $(ssh-agent)" >> .bashrc ?
that will create a new ssh-agent everytime bash is run, so that's not such a good idea ... I'm not sure what the best way is :/
his google-hit explains some ways to do it http://mah.everybody.org/docs/ssh
btw, thanks
No problem.
